strings:
<se_low>King Trode: It would be quite impossible to turn down such an honest plea for help.
We must accept Raya's request for assistance.

<se_low>King Trode: And how fortunate that it coincides with our own ends!
The rampage of the sceptre must be stopped!
<se_low>Yangus: But I still don't get it.
<se_low>King Trode: Don't ‘get’ what exactly, you buffoon!?
<se_low>Yangus: How's all this gonna 'elp you an' the 'orse-princess get rid of yer curse, Grandad?

<se_low>King Trode: Hm, yes well... That is precisely the problem.
The most important issue remains disappointingly unresolved.

<se_low>King Trode: Nevertheless, for the time being we must press on and bring the sceptre under control, thus preventing the resurrection of the Lord of Darkness.<page>King Trode: Other matters shall have to wait.
<se_low>King Trode: I've no doubt that the Darktree leaf we received from Raya will prove extremely useful to us on our journey.
<se_low>King Trode: Receiving help, by which I mean commanding others to provide necessary assistance, forms the basis of my entire philosophy on life.
<se_low>King Trode: David was that young fellow who was skewered with the sceptre by that large dog in Arcadia, was he not?
<se_low>King Trode: I would never have guessed such events would have anything to do with this little colony tucked away in the mountains.
<se_low>King Trode: Good day!
<se_low>King Trode: Top of the morning to you!

<se_low>King Trode: Elevenses on Wednesday?
Why, certainly!
<se_low>King Trode: Ah, yes! It's wonderful to be able to walk around with my customary majesty again, without scornful stares from onlookers!
<se_low>King Trode: So we must promenade! Every spare moment will be given over to parading around in true self-congratulatory fashion! Follow me!
<se_high>Jessica: David... Just hearing his name is painful.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel terrible about what happened to him. I can't help thinking that he'd still be alive now if I'd just acted a little more carefully.
<se_high>Jessica: David... Just hearing his name is painful.
<se_high>Jessica: I feel terrible about what happened to him. I can't help thinking that he'd still be alive now if I'd just acted a little more carefully.
<se_high>Jessica: King Trode looks so happy. Well, it isn't hard to understand why.

<se_high>Jessica: This is a rare occasion.
We should let the King lead the way for a change!
<se_low>Yangus: The World o' Darkness is the place that Empyrea bird was, right?

<se_low>Yangus: So that's where this Darktree thing's growing then, is it?
I dunno!<page>Yangus: All this weird stuff goin' on that I didn't know nuffin' about makes me feel a bit thick sometimes.

<se_low>Yangus: I've been around a fair few years longer than you, guv.
Gettin' up to no good an' all, but still...
<se_low>Yangus: This is the first time I've ever 'ad a chat wiv an elf, I can tell ya.

<se_low>Yangus: Oh, 'ang on!
Didn't she say she was gonna give us somefin'?
Better not forget about that, eh!?
<se_low>Yangus: This is the first time old Grandad's been able to walk around in town since we was in Pickham, ain't it?
<se_low>Yangus: Let's 'ope nuffin' goes wrong 'ere like it did back there. Cor, we was in a right mess when the 'orse-princess was kidnapped, eh!?

<se_def>Angelo: New toys are for playing with.
That's my philosophy.
<se_def>Angelo: If the Darktree leaf can tell us where that dog is, we'll finally be able to chase it down and dispose of it.
<se_def>Angelo: So it was Raya giving off all the pheromones.

<se_def>Angelo: Human, elf, it doesn't bother me.
Beauty is the only condition I need to see satisfied.

<se_def>Angelo: A mix of monsters, elves and humans...
Hm, maybe I was wrong to expect to catch any beauties here.

<se_def>Angelo: But there are pheromones in the air.
It's unmistakable.
<se_low>King Trode: I shan't deny that I'm fond of this valley, but this is hardly the right time to come here!

<se_low>King Trode: What about the Lord High Priest!?
That's what we should be investigating!
<se_high>Jessica: I have no idea what may happen next, but...
<se_high>Jessica: I can't shake the feeling that we may not be able to make Raya's wish come true.

<se_low>Yangus: Er...ain't this the wrong place?
This ain't where the Lord 'Igh Priest lives, is it?
<se_def>Angelo: We're just supposed to swallow the fact that the Lord High Priest's death was an accident, are we!?<page>Angelo: Don't ask too many questions, is that it!?
<se_def>Angelo: We protected him! We put our lives on the line for him!<page>Angelo: And now they expect us to believe he died like that? It makes me sick!

<se_low>King Trode: The people in this valley should be all too well acquainted with the Lord of Darkness.
And they do look gloomy, don't they?

<se_low>King Trode: Is he really such a formidable foe?
Oooh, this is all starting to get more and more worrisome.
<se_high>Jessica: It's hard to believe that this Lord of Darkness, this single being, is threatening the entire world.

<se_high>Jessica: What gives him the right!?
Just thinking about it makes my blood boil.
<se_low>Yangus: I knew there was elves an' stuff in the world, but I never thought I'd actually meet one!

<se_low>Yangus: I'm a well-rounded bloke now, see.
That's why. Straight as a die.
It's elves I mix wiv now, not dwarves.
<se_def>Angelo: Well, it looks like we couldn't deliver on Raya's request.

<se_def>Angelo: But what's done is done.
We've got to focus on the problems at hand now.
<se_low>King Trode: It seems they could see the red sky even here, so far away from the Holy Isle of Neos.
<se_low>King Trode: Hmm... Rhapthorne's might is truly monstrous.
<se_high>Jessica: Hey. If we find the seven orbs, break through Rhapthorne's dark shield, and defeat him...
<se_high>Jessica: ...Do you think more monsters will become friendly? Like the ones here in Tryan Gully?
<se_low>Yangus: Orbs, orbs, orbs... Don't look like there's any 'round 'ere, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: Why don't you 'ave a puff on that flute an' see?
<se_def>Angelo: If only Raya had the orbs in amongst all that treasure of hers. ...As if we'd ever be that lucky!
<se_def>Angelo: Oh well. No sense in thinking like that. They're out there and we need to find them, end of story. Let's get on with it.
<se_high>Red: Sounds like an 'ole lot's gone on 'ere before I joined ya.

<se_high>Red: I ain't got nuffin' to say about it, seein' as I
weren't there. It wouldn't be my place to try
an' comfort no one. Nah, I'll leave well alone,
I think.
<se_high>Red: Blimey, I weren't expectin' to come across an 'ole race of elves 'ere.
<se_high>Red: Accordin' to legend, the elves ain't just beautiful, they're immortal an' all.
<se_high>Red: I tell ya wot, maybe they've got 'oards o' treasure they scored off some great old monster or summat, eh? ...Wot? A girl can dream, can't she?
<se_high>Red: Wot's up wiv old wrinkly, eh? Got ants in 'is pants, 'as 'e? I'm gonna 'ave to start pretendin' I ain't wiv 'im if 'e carries on actin' like a prize turnip.
<se_high>Red: Mind you, I s'pose it's been 'ard for 'im, lookin' like a pickled gherkin on legs all this time.
<se_low>Morrie: I do not know all what is happening before, but this Davide was having molto respect for you, ragazzo, si? Until the ends of his days, ay?

<se_low>Morrie: Then he had the good eye! Allora! For Davide,
we must make the dead dog meat from this Leopoldo!
<se_low>Yangus: Morrie, it ain't Davide and it ain't Leopoldo! Stop addin' bits on!
<se_low>Morrie: Che? Ah, scusi, scusi. I try it again from the tops! ...For David, ay, we must make the dead dog meat from this Leopold...o.
<se_low>Morrie: I am sometimes hearing the whispers on the wind about a race of elves, but I never imagine it is true.
<se_low>Morrie: And now I am meeting them in the flesh and bones! Things like this, they make the life worth a while, ay?
<se_low>Morrie: Ah ha ha ha! The Don Toad, he is <endash> How do you say? <endash> in his elephant! Maybe we open a bottle of Lambrusco and make a celebrazioni, ay?
<se_high>Red: Can we really be sure the Lord 'Igh Priest 'as popped 'is clogs though, eh? I'm just sayin', I ain't believin' nuffin' 'til I've seen it wiv me own eyes.
<se_high>Red: So let's get over to 'is place now and see wot's wot.
<se_low>Morrie: The death of the Lord High Priest will send the shocking waves all around the world, ay?
<se_high>Red: We used to think Yangus might be 'alf dwarf when 'e was a kid. But 'e ain't. Truth is, 'e's 'alf man, 'alf 'alf-'og. ...Sometimes I wonder wot the other quarter is.
<se_high>Red: But anyway, don't go thinkin' 'e's just a useless lump o' lard, will ya, <hero>? I mean, 'e can be a bit of a numpty at times, but 'e tries 'is best.
<se_low>Yangus: Oi! I ain't 'alf nuffin'! I've got all me bits, an' all me facultrees. Stop tellin' the guv stuff that ain't true, Red!
<se_low>Morrie: I was thinking I have <endash> How do you say? <endash> my fingers on the veins of this world. But I did not know about these elves. Or about the Lord of the Darkness.
<se_low>Morrie: This avventura with you, it is teaching the old dog nude tricks, ay? Ah ha ha!
